name: I Have an Idea
description: Starting point for validating a new idea and planning MVP
user_situation: I have an idea for an app but don't know where to start
objectives: Validate the problem is worth solving

journey_steps.why: Validate the problem before falling in love with your solution
key_questions: Can you describe the problem without mentioning your app?
Who has this problem and how badly do they need it solved?
How do they solve it today and what's wrong with that?

checkpoint.question: Can you articulate the job to be done without mentioning your solution?

journey_steps.why: Sketch how users will accomplish their goals
journey_steps.deliverable: Simple workflow diagram or written scenario

journey_steps.why: Define MVP scope - what's in, what's out, what's later
key_questions: What's the absolute minimum to prove the concept?
What can you cut and still solve the core problem?
What feels critical but is actually nice-to-have?

journey_steps.why: Identify 3 things that could go really wrong
journey_steps.deliverable: List of 3 critical threats and simple mitigations

journey_steps.why: Choose simplest architecture that could work for MVP
key_questions: Can you use existing services instead of building?
Are you over-engineering for future scale?

completion_criteria: Can explain the problem without mentioning your solution
MVP scope is clear and minimal

after_step_1.question: Is this problem worth solving?
after_step_1.if_no: Consider pivoting or exploring different problem space
after_step_1.if_unsure: Talk to 5 potential users before continuing

after_step_3.question: Can you build MVP in 2-4 weeks?

next_steps_after_journey: Follow MVP Launch track to build and ship
Validate assumptions with real users before building
Consider New Developer path for full lifecycle overview
common_mistakes_to_avoid: Skipping problem validation and jumping to solution
Defining MVP that takes 6+ months to build
Choosing complex architecture before proving concept
